title: Thai Green Curry
ingredients: * 1/2 cup green beans, trimmed and cut in half
procedure: 1. Heat the coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the lemongrass, garlic, galangal, ginger, and green chilies and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
3. Add the bamboo shoots, red bell pepper, green beans, and cherry tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
4. Add the coconut milk, green curry paste, vegetable broth, and lime juice and bring to a simmer.
5. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the curry has thickened.
6. Stir in the fish sauce and basil leaves and cook for 1 minute more.
7. Serve the curry over rice, garnished with chopped peanuts.

title: Pad Thai
procedure: 1. Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 15 minutes, or until they are softened.
2. Drain the noodles and rinse them with cold water.
3. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
4. Add the beaten egg and cook for 1 minute, or until it is scrambled.
5. Add the tofu, shrimp, and chicken and cook for 5 minutes, or until they are cooked through.
6. Add the rice noodles, tamarind sauce, fish sauce, palm sugar, crushed peanuts, green onions, cilantro, and lime wedges to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Cook the Pad Thai for 5 minutes, or until the noodles are heated through.
8. Serve the Pad Thai immediately, garnished with bean sprouts.

title: Tom Yum Soup
procedure: 1. Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a large pot.
2. Add the lemongrass, garlic, galangal, ginger, and green chilies and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
3. Add the mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, cilantro leaves, lime wedges, fish sauce, tamarind paste, and turmeric powder to the pot and stir to combine.
4. Reduce heat to low and simmer the soup for 15 minutes, or until the flavors have melded.
5. Serve the Tom Yum Soup immediately, garnished with chopped peanuts.
